results.title: Sleepless in Seattle
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Gary Foster and Nora Ephron
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as a recently widowed architect with a young son who moves to Seattle on the East Coast of America to escape the painful memories of his life with his wife. Meg Ryan is a recently engaged journalist who believes she has found the perfect man in her fiancee. Its Christmas, the silly season and Hanks young son has called a talk-back show to try and help his Dad move on with life. Ryan hears his conversation with the radio announcer who calls him Sleepless in Seattle. His words strike a chord in Ryan who begins to doubt if her comfortable life is really all she wants. Thus begins a story of chance and double-chance and of finding true love. This one of the most enchanting romantic comedies ever created.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tri-Star Pictures, Gary Foster and Nora Ephron

results.title: Sleeping dogs
results.brief_description: Against the background of political turmoil a loner on the run is caught between the forces of a repressive government and guerillas in the resistance movement in this fast paced political thriller/action/buddy movie. Set in an imagined totalitarian future, the film and the book on which it was based foresaw some of the confrontations between authorities and protesters that marked the 1981 Springbok Rugby Tour of New Zealand. The debut feature for both director Roger Donaldson and actor Sam Neill, this film is recognised as marking the beginning of contemporary New Zealand cinema. Cast includes Sam Neill, Ian Mune, Warren Oates, Nevan Rowe and Donna Akersten. Based on the novel ‘Smith’s Dream’ by C.K. Stead. Reference: ‘New Zealand Film 1912-1996’ eds. Helen Martin and Sam Edwards. Oxford University Press, Auckland 1997.

results.title: Sleeping Beauty
results.brief_description: This production of the classic ballet, “Sleeping Beauty” is performed by the Australian Ballet. Performed live at The Victorian Arts Centre, October 9, 1984, this ballet in a prologue and three acts has the beautiful Christine Walsh dancing the role of Aurora with touches of tenderness and grace, and David Ashmole creating an outstanding Prince Florimund. Music is performed by The Elizabethan Melbourne Orchestra, conducted by Ritchie Hanna.

results.title: Sleeping beauty
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Walt Disney and Clyde Geronimi
results.brief_description: Once upon a time, in a kingdom far away, a beautiful princess was born, destined by a terrible curse to be drawn into a spectacular adventure of unparalleled suspense and fantasy. Experience the joy and magic of this thrilling Disney classic. Features the voices of Mary Costa, Bill Shirley, Eleanor Audley, Verna Felton, Barbara Luddy, Bill Thompson.

results.title: Sleepers
results.creator_credit: Baltimore Pictures, Propaganda Films, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Barry Levinson and Steve Golin
results.brief_description: Based on a true story “Sleepers” is the story of four boyhood friends, growing up in Hells Kitchen, New York, in the 1960s. The boys are depicted as carefree enough, despite an indulgence in petty crime and, in the case of one, watching his mother get beaten by his father. In the summer of 1966 however their lives are altered forever when a prank goes wrong and a man is accidentally killed. The boys are sentenced to one year in a boys home where they are beaten, psychologically abused and raped by male guards. Thirteen years later, as adults, all four men are given an opportunity to avenge their childhood abuse. To do this effectively they must ask many around them to compromise who they are and what they stand for, in particular their childhood priest and confidant Father Bobby. A story of coming of age and of revenge, “Sleepers” was plagued with controversy upon its release as the authenticity of the story was challenged. Starring: Brad Pitt, Jason Patric, Billy Crudup, Kevin Bacon, Ron Eldard, Minnie Driver and Dustin Hoffman. Directed by Barry Levinson (Good Morning, Vietnam, Rainman, Diner, Bandits).

results.title: Sleeper
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Jack Grossberg and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: A witty, futuristic comedy with Allen brought back to life after 200 years in the year 2173 to find himself a wanted man in a totally regulated society. Allen is hunted as a dangerous alien, and in the course of avoiding capture, he first becomes a robot-servant to dippy artist, Diane Keaton, and, after revealing his true identity to her, embarks with her on an hilarious series of improbable escapades.

results.title: Sleep my love
results.creator_credit: Triangle Productions, Mary Pickford, Charles Rogers, Ralph Cohn and Douglas Sirk
results.brief_description: In this noir mystery thriller, a wealthy heiress (Claudette Colbert) wakes up hysterical on board a train from New York to Boston with no idea how she got there. When she contacts her husband (Don Ameche), he informs her that she disappeared after threatening him with a gun. On her return he urges her to visit an eminent psychiatrist. Soon it becomes clear that her apparently loving husband is in fact plotting to drive her to insanity then kill her and collect her fortune. Though dismissed by Sirk himself, this is a tautly paced thriller, with Joseph Valentine’s expressionist photography giving rise to a suitably nightmarish evocation of insanity and shifting appearances. Cast also includes Robert Cummings, Rita Johnson and George Coulouris.

results.title: Sleep for health
results.brief_description: Presents the importance of regular sleeping habits from the viewpoint of a child. Shows the child how a regular bed-time which allows for sufficient sleep helps them attain goals which they desire. Emphasises the child’s own responsibility in the formation of good habits. Considers dreaming as a normal part of sleeping. Illustrates how lack of sleep causes irritability and interferes with the enjoyment of everyday living.

results.title: Sleep and dreaming
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College and Carol Trussell
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
What is sleep? What are dreams and what use, if any, do they have? The average person spends seven and a half hours asleep and a third of that time dreaming. Freud was the first person to attempt a coherent theory of dreams, although his idea of the dream being a special access to the repressed unconscious which holds the secret of mental disorders, has largely been discredited. Now sleep patterns can be accurately measured but there are still no proven explanations for dreams. This program explores some of the latest research into these two mystifying areas.
